pullRequest.body:
This lets lemmas about cancellative monoids work for cancellative semigroups

Some docstrings have been rewritten, as adjusting the wording was too awkward.

The new `.all` names are intended to match `Commute.all`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/82151989-f445-4ab0-920c-3ef528a847f7) for commit 72befab820e7b493e132bbb92554467e81139450.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/f80d8dfc-e542-4230-aaaf-05d1b7c6c185/to/82151989-f445-4ab0-920c-3ef528a847f7) against commit 3fbcf0e064d06994e24f42a8b5c0245ddc9115d0:
```diff
  Benchmark                                                  Metric         Change
  ================================================================================
- open Mathlib                                               wall-clock       8.4%
+ ~Mathlib.RepresentationTheory.GroupCohomology.Resolution   instructions    -1.7%
```

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6968999255/job/18964008530)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6968999255/job/18964008941)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6968999255/job/18964007982)
These new names are a bit weird; shouldn't this be `IsLeftCancelMul.isLeftRegular`?

probably
```suggestion
  MonoidAlgebra.support_mul_single (G := Multiplicative G) hr _
```
works
(1 more below)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Algebra/Regular/Basic): generalize to `IsCancelMul`
